Reason: The 'threads' configuration option in the sunflow software project is performance-sensitive because changing the number of threads can significantly impact system performance. Increasing the number of threads can improve parallel processing and potentially reduce execution time, but it can also lead to increased memory consumption and potential contention for shared resources. Conversely, decreasing the number of threads may result in slower execution times due to underutilization of available resources. Therefore, the 'threads' configuration option has a notable impact on system performance and is considered performance-sensitive.
